Title:
Smilax canariensis, S. azorica (Smilacaceae) and the genus
Smilax in Europe.
Abstract:
A morphological and molecular systematic analysis of the
European species of Smilax results in the recognition of a species
endemic to the Azores, Smilax azorica H. Schaef. & P. Schoenfelder,
nom. nov. (= S. divaricata Sol. ex H. C. Wats., nom. illegit.). Its
closest relative is S. canariensis Brouss. ex Willd. from the Canaries
and Madeira. Together with the Eastern European S. excelsa L. they are
nested in a clade of North American species, which seem to belong to an
Asian lineage.
